jobDescription: Title: Data ScientistLocation: Washington, DCSalary: $175,000 to $200,000Contact: Paul Chatlos, pchatlos@smithhanley.comOur client company is growing their machine learning and data science capabilities to assist clients to better understand their most challenging problems. They are looking for an individual to work within their diverse technical teams to design, evaluate and build data models. Data Scientist Responsibilities:-Develop a strategy to maximize all possible value from client's available data-Work with customer from concept through delivery -Assess client data type and quality and work through the most difficult problems -Problem solve at the core of data-led simulation working with our research team or independently -Demonstrate and ensure the reliability of models created. -Prototyping and designing of new technical approaches by keeping up to date with cutting edge research Data Scientist Qualifications: -Experience working with external clients in the delivery of data rich projects. -MS in Statistics, Math, Computer Science or other fields with a computational element-Fluent Programming Capabilities-Python, R, and many other related libraries and tools -Must possess a Top Secret clearance and prior government work -Previous work with Big Data Technologies and Probabilistic Programming a plus
